intro: Faurea delevoyi, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Molokaʻi in Hawaii. It is a shrub that typically grows in moist, shaded areas, often found in coastal forests. The plant features large, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Faurea delevoyi plays an important role in the local ecosystem and is considered a keystone species in its native habitat.
